Crazy idea: controlling the random numbers?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Crazy idea: controlling the random numbers?
By Zekira G. Drake on Thursday, February 28, 2013 - 11:03 pm:

OK so I know that whatever test I did here is very inconclusive for the fact that I have had it only happen around 10 times. Just thought I'd share, and may spark a bit of those researcher vibes back for some people here lol?

Let me first start by stating that, in the in-depth game mechanics research of Pokemon, I don't think any other game has ever been researched than that; the RNG manipulation to obtain perfect Pokemon consistently just goes to show that, where people can actually now control the exact stats/natures/whatever of a Pokemon they hatch/encounter when it is normally a process deemed 'random'.

ever since I learned of that, every game I've been playing now that has an insane amount of randomness, I've been trying out methods to try and mess with the RNG of the game in hopes of finding a somewhat wild method of getting better results more consistently than just being 'random'. I won't cover the exact details.

In this case with MR2, it just happened to me now, for 10 straight weeks of training; for some odd reason my Colorpandora at its prime was just continuously FAILING his Swim drills, or Cheating it, no matter how many reloads I do. It was stupid. It even came to a point I was reloading for 30 minutes just to get that Success. "What gives?" obviously I asked...

Then the next few weeks I was getting so frustrated and bored reloading again so much that I actually began pressing Triangle on stuff rather than X, and repeatedly selecting drills and whatnot, random stuff. Then boom, in the week I did that, he received a Great.

I was like "...nah, coincidence."

But it happened again the next week where he was failing his Swim drills like mad, even if the colorpandora was jumping when I selected the Swim Drill!

What I then did was that I selected Swim Drill, pressed No, selected it again... until I pressed No on it 3 times. Then went on the Swim Drill for the 4th selection, and he ends up with a success or a great.

Take note that for all 10 weeks, he was excessively failing his Swim Drills, making sure he failed at least 30 times for each week (reloading), then doing the Select-No-Select-No-Select-No-Select-Yes rotation, immediately giving me a success for all 10 straight times.

Yeah this is all a very outrageous claim. Again, I just wanted to share. But take note of my first paragraph above, where a game like Pokemon actually had researchers who were able to crack and manipulate the 'random' number generator at will! (using various factors like: frame activity, initial seed, system clock and date, system's MAC Address for DS version Pokemon)

By Zekira G. Drake on Thursday, February 28, 2013 - 11:17 pm:

btw let me just update that after the 10 straight occurrences, it never happened to me again consistently...
